methods.name: <init>

params.name: openMode
params.comment: the open mode for the program.

throws.comment: if a database io error occurs.
if the database version is different from the expected version

methods.javadoc: Returns the address factory for the program.
methods.name: getAddressFactory
methods.comment: Returns the address factory for the program.

methods.javadoc: Returns the AddressMap from the program.
methods.name: getAddressMap
methods.comment: Returns the AddressMap from the program.

methods.name: fireBlocksJoined
methods.comment:
Two blocks have been joined producing newBlock.  The block which was
 eliminated can be identified using the oldBlockStartAddr.

methods.name: match

params.name: addr
params.comment: The beginning address in memory to test against.

params.name: bytes
params.comment: the array of bytes to test for.

params.name: masks
params.comment: the array of masks. (One for each byte in the byte array)

params.name: forward
params.comment: if true, the matching is going forward, otherwise backward

return.comment:
1 if there is a match
         0 if there is no match
        -i if no match is found, this is the number of bytes that can be safely skipped

methods.name: checkRemoveAddressSpace
methods.comment:
Tests if the given addressSpace (overlay space) is used by any blocks.  If not, it
 removes the space.

methods.name: getMappedIntersection
methods.comment:
Gets the intersected set of addresses between a list of mapped memory blocks, and some other
 address set.

params.name: block
params.comment: The mapped memory block to use in the intersection.

params.name: set
params.comment: Some other address set to use in the intersection.

return.comment: The intersected set of addresses between 'mappedMemoryBlock' and other address set

methods.javadoc: Converts the given address range back from the source range back to the mapped range.
methods.name: getMappedRange
methods.comment: Converts the given address range back from the source range back to the mapped range.

methods.name: getBlocks
methods.comment: Returns a list of all memory blocks that contain any addresses in the given range

return.comment: a list of all memory blocks that contain any addresses in the given range
